items.text: [small][b]NOTE[/b]: When selecting ramp startup in DCS, aircraft is already pre-configured according to this checklist. It is provided here for reference only.[/small]

items.comment: Night only.
Verify all caution/warning lights illuminate.

items.text: FIRE DETECT BLEED AIR LEAK TEST
items.comment: Verify fire T-handles and BLEED AIR LEAK alert illuminate.
Totalizer should be 6000 pounds with main tanks full.
Verify OXY LOW caution light illuminates when oxygen quantity is less than 0.5 liters.
APU EGT should stabilize at 400°C - 450°C with APU RPM at 100%. EGT will spike at 760°C.
Continue checklist while EGI BIT and alignment completes.
Pull HM, IM, FM, VHF, UHF switches. Set volume as desired.
Do not start aircraft engines until cleared by ATC.
Move throttle out of OFF detent.
L core RPM should stabilize at 56% with ITT between 275°C and 865°C. ITT will spike at 900°C.
HYD SYS L pressure should stabilize between 2800 PSI and 3350 PSI.
Move throttle out of OFF detent.
R core RPM should stabilize at 56% with ITT between 275°C and 865°C. ITT will spike at 900°C.
HYD SYS R pressure should stabilize between 2800 and 3350 PSI.
Monitor L HYD SYS hydraulic pressure.
Monitor R HYD SYS hydraulic pressure.
Test disconnect with control stick paddle switch, then re-engage.
Verify TAKEOFF TRIM light illuminates.
Continue checklist while IFFCC BIT completes.
Set to DAY or NIGHT per pilot preference.
Continue checklist while MFCDs power on.
Wait for data load to complete.
Verify flight member symbols visible on TAD.
Verify all systems operational.
Verify data upload completed. Configure weapon systems as desired.
After BIT is complete, set CCIP Consent, AAS, 30 MM, and display modes as desired.
Set when SYS / INS / ALIGN page indicates alignment complete (T = 4.0 0.8).
Configure CMSP programs per mission briefing.
Verify flap position MVR (7°) with gauge on Landing Gear Control Panel.
Set to TAXI at night.
Do not taxi aircraft until cleared by ATC.
Core RPM should not exceed 70%.
Verify toe brakes operational when aircraft starts moving.

items.text: [small][li]Taxi speed between 15 KTS and 25 KTS.[/li][li]Use rudder pedals to steer aircraft on ground.[/li][li]To stop, set throttles to IDLE and apply toe brakes.[/li][/small]

items.comment: Set to LAND at night.
Do not enter runway until cleared by ATC.

items.text: Line up on runway centerline after receiving clearance from ATC.

items.comment: Ensure normal readings.
Ensure no caution lights active.
Deactivate NWS when airspeed passes 70 KTS.

items.text: [small][li]Rotate to 10° pitch approximately 10 KTS before takeoff speed.[/li][li]Takeoff speed is approximately 135 KTS with combat load.[/li][/small]
[small][b]NOTE[/b]: Complete fence in checklist prior to entering combat area.[/small]

items.comment: Set to GUNARM if PAC not desired.
AGM-65 electro-optical alignment takes approximately 3 minutes.
Assess aircraft control, damage, and fuel quantity.
Set to TAXI at night.

items.text: [b]NOTE[/b]: Engines must be set to IDLE for 5 minutes before proceeding.
items.comment: Taxi time may be included if core RPM was < 80%.
Notify tanker of intent to refuel on VHF AM radio. Do not approach tanker until cleared.
Disable fill to damaged / leaking fuel tanks.
Disable fill to damaged / leaking fuel tanks.
Request clearance to contact tanker boom on VHF AM radio.

items.text: Approach tanker boom at differential speed of 2-3 knots. Allow the boom operator to "fly" the boom to the refuel slipway. Do not chase the boom.
If aircraft disconnects from boom before refueling is complete:
Approach boom and allow operator to reconnect with the aircraft.
Reduce power. Move down and away from the tanker into an observation position.

items.comment: Re-select the flap position at which the asymmetry first occurred.
Set flaps to MVR when speed and altitude permit.

items.text: [small][b]NOTE[/b]: Aileron and elevator jams are indicated by the [b]AIL L / R[/b] and [b]ELEV L / R[/b] caution lights, respectively.[/small]

items.comment: Move the appropriate emergency disengage switch in the direction indicated by the jam indicator light.

items.text: [small][b]NOTE[/b]: The effects of hypoxia are simulated in DCS. You will notice your vision slowly starting to fade, similar to G-induced loss of consciousness.[/small]
[b]NOTE[/b]: If oxygen system is set correctly and symptoms are not relieved, descend to below 13000 FT as soon as possible.
If engine fire T-handle light does not extinguish:
[small][b]NOTE[/b]: If both presses of discharge switch fail to extinguish fire, land and exit aircraft as soon as possible.[/small]
[small][b]NOTE[/b]: Be prepared to eject if aircraft becomes uncontrollable.[/small]
If APU fire T-handle light does not extinguish:
[small][b]NOTE[/b]: If both presses of discharge switch fail to extinguish fire, land and exit aircraft as soon as possible.[/small]
[small][b]NOTE[/b]: Be prepared to eject if aircraft becomes uncontrollable.[/small]

[small][b]NOTE[/b]: In an emergency, an APU restart may be attempted if it is needed for electrical power or an engine restart. Closely monitor APU temperature and shut it down immediately if it overheats again.[/small]
[small][b]NOTE[/b]: These instructions apply to engine oil over-pressure and under-pressure failures. Such failures are indicated by the [b]ENG OIL PRESS L / R[/b] caution lights.[/small]
If oil pressure can be maintained above 30 PSI:
If oil pressure cannot be maintained above 30 PSI:

items.comment: If oil pressure cannot be maintained above 30 PSI, the engine must be shut down to avoid damage / failure.

items.text: [small][b]NOTE[/b]: Main fuel boost pump failures are indicated by the [b]MAIN PUMP L / R[/b] caution lights.[/small]

[small][b]NOTE[/b]: Fuel pressure will still be provided by wing boost pumps if they are operating. If both main and wing boost pumps fail, suction feed will supply the engines below 10000 FT. Engine performance will be reduced above this altitude.[/small]
If fuel transfer between tanks is too fast:
[small][b]NOTE[/b]: Wing fuel boost pump failures are indicated by the [b]WING PUMP L / R[/b] caution lights.[/small]
[small][b]NOTE[/b]: Fuel in the affected tank will not transfer until quantity is below 600 LB. This can lead to a weight imbalance if let unchecked.[/small]
If fuel transfer between tanks is too fast:
[small][b]NOTE[/b]: Fuel pressure faults are indicated by the [b]FUEL PRESS L / R[/b] caution lights.[/small]
If caution light does not extinguish:

items.comment: Monitor fuel quantities to determine if a leak exists.

items.text: If a fuel leak is detected in either engine:

items.comment: Only necessary if fuel leak is in right engine.
Hold switch in MOTOR position for at least 30 seconds.
Set throttle of affected engine to OFF. Engine ITT should cool rapidly.
Descent to below 15000 FT prior to proceeding.
Wait until inoperative engine ITT is below 100°C.
Move throttle out of OFF detent.
Monitor engine gauges and ensure restart proceeds as expected.

items.text: [small][b]NOTE[/b]: Engine restart using APU is preferred whenever possible.[/small]
[small][b]NOTE[/b]: Windmill starts require a dive of a 6000 - 8000 FT, and are therefore not possible when aircraft is below 10000 FT AGL.[/small]
Once ITT of inoperative engine is below 150°C, place aircraft in a 30° dive.
Wait for inoperative engine to resume normal operation.
items.comment: Monitor altitude loss during dive. Abort engine restart if aircraft will descend below 2000 FT AGL.

items.text: [small][b]NOTE[/b]: If possible, eject above:[li]2000 FT AGL in level flight[/li][li]4000 FT AGL in uncontrolled flight[/li][/small]
Turn aircraft towards uninhabited area. Trim to lowest practical speed. Hold wings level.

items.comment: Verify all landing gear indicators illuminate.

items.text: Check L HYD SYS hydraulic pressure. If pressure is normal:

items.comment: Roll aircraft rapidly to attempt to shake gear loose.

items.text: [b]NOTE[/b]: Burn as much fuel as possible prior to attempting a gear-up landing to reduce aircraft weight and possibility of fire.

items.comment: In addition to stores, fire all flares prior to attempting landing to reduce risk of fire.

items.text: Touch down on center of runway with [b]minimum possible[/b] sink rate.

items.comment: Shut down engines as soon as aircraft comes to a complete stop.

items.text: Exit the aircraft as soon as possible.

items.comment: Select the program to be edited using the NXT rocker on the CMSP panel.
Press the SET button for the value to be edited.
Use the NXT rocker to adjust the selected value up or down.
When all values have been set, press the RTN button to save the program.
Pressing RTN a second time returns to the DISP status page.

items.text: [small]CMSP settings are as follows:[li][b]CHAF[/b]: Number of chaff bundles to release per cycle[/li][li][b]FLAR[/b]: Number of flares to release per cycle[/li][li][b]INTV[/b]: Time between release cycles, in seconds[/li][li][b]CYCL[/b]: Number of cycles in program[/li][/small]

items.comment: Set to GUNARM if PAC not desired.
Cycle gunsights by pressing DMS left / right.

items.text: [small][li]Maneuver aircraft to place pipper on target.[/li][li]Pull trigger to fire cannon.[/li][/small]
[small]Trigger actions are as follows:[li][b]First Stage[/b]: Activate PAC[/li][li][b]Second Stage[/b]: Fire Cannon[/li][/small]

items.comment: Set to CCIP or CCRP as desired.
Cycle weapon profiles by pressing DMS left / right.

items.text: [small][li]Maneuver aircraft to place pipper on target.[/li][li]Press and hold Weapon Release Button until all rockets in ripple have fired.[/li][/small]

[small][li]Maneuver aircraft to align pipper over ASL on the HUD.[/li][li]As solution cue drops down ASL, press and hold Weapon Release Button.[/li][li]Rockets will fire when solution cue passes through pipper.[/li][li]Do not release Weapon Release Button until all rockets in ripple have fired.[/li][/small]

items.comment: Set to 3/9, 5MIL, or OFF as desired.
Set to CCIP or CCRP as desired.
Cycle weapon profiles by pressing DMS left / right.

items.text: [small][li]Maneuver aircraft to place pipper on target.[/li][li]Press and hold Weapon Release Button until all bombs in ripple have released.[/li][/small]

[small][li]Maneuver aircraft to align pipper over ASL on the HUD.[/li][li]As solution cue drops down ASL, press and hold Weapon Release Button.[/li][li]Bombs will release when solution cue passes through pipper.[/li][li]Do not release Weapon Release Button until all bombs in ripple have released.[/li][/small]

[small][li]Maneuver aircraft to place pipper on target.[/li][li]Press and hold Weapon Release Button, then pitch back to return to level flight.[/li][li]Maneuver aircraft to align pipper over ASL on the HUD.[/li][li]Bombs will release when solution cue passes through pipper.[/li][li]Do not release Weapon Release Button until all bombs in ripple have released.[/li][/small]

items.comment: Ensure TGP laser code matches LGB seeker code as shown in DSMS.
Press TMS forward long to designate TGP as SPI.
Cycle weapon profiles by pressing DMS left / right.

items.text: [small][li]Maneuver aircraft to align pipper over ASL on the HUD.[/li][li]As solution cue drops down ASL, press and hold Weapon Release Button.[/li][li]Bombs will release when solution cue passes through pipper.[/li][li]Do not release Weapon Release Button until all bombs in ripple have released.[/li][/small]

[small][li]Ensure that TGP has a clear line of sight to the target until bomb impact.[/li][li]If AUTO LASE option is not set, press NWS button on control stick to lase target.[/li][li]For best results, delay lasing until approximately 8 seconds before projected impact.[/li][/small]

items.comment: Press TMS forward long to designate SPI. IAMs can target any type of SPI, including steerpoint, TDC, TGP, TAD, Maverick, etc.
Cycle weapon profiles by pressing DMS left / right.

items.text: [small][li]Maneuver aircraft to align pipper over ASL on the HUD.[/li][li]Release cue will move counter-clockwise around pipper as aircraft approaches the designated target.[/li][li]When release cue is between the minimum/maximum range carets, press and hold Weapon Release Button.[/li][li]Do not release Weapon Release Button until all bombs in ripple have released.[/li][/small]

items.comment: Mavericks require 3 minute alignment before use, starting when EO power is turned on.
Pressing TMS forward short will command the MAV to attempt to lock on at the current reticle position.

items.text: [small][li]It is normally easiest to designate an SPI using the TGP, TDC, or TAD, and then slave the Maverick seeker to the SPI by pressing China Hat Forward Long.[/li][li]Range caret will begin descending DLZ scale on MAV MFCD page at approximately 10 NM slant range.[/li][li]Maverick will normally lock on to target at a range of 3 - 7 NM.[/li][li]Once the seeker has locked the target, press and hold the Weapon Release Button until the Maverick has fully launched.[/li][/small]
